title: Is it advisable to file bankruptcy or should i do debt relief?
question: I started chemo therapy treatment this year and i am in really bad debt..maybe, around 75k..that’s using my cards for daily living and medical bills. Is it advisable to go thru bankruptcy? debt forgiveness progam wanted me to pay 1300/ month which is hard since i am a single mom and my son is still in high school. We wouldn’t have enough money for food if i sign that debt relief contract
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
I'd be very surprised to find that a debt consolidation company can get you the relief that a Chapter 7 bankruptcy will deliver. A Chapter 7 will give you a fresh start with the discharge. Be careful on your timing of filing the case because you may have tons more medical bills to consider. In over 30 years filing bankruptcy cases I seldom meet someone who is please with the "debt consolidation" route. That's why they end up coming to me.

Hope this perspective is helpful.

Your financial situation is ripe for a bankruptcy filing but there are many moving parts to a BK. BK is not a DIY project consisting of checking boxes on forms you find on-line. Find/consult/hire an Avvo BK lawyer by using the "Find a Lawyer" feature. Make a list consisting of several BK lawyers having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back, go on to the next one on your list. Some of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it. If this answer was helpful, please leave your feedback on the Avvo website as “best answer or helpful”. Good luck to you.

Bankruptcy is probably your best bet, but if you're still incurring medical bills with no end in sight then you don't want to rush your bankruptcy filing. You need to consult with an experienced bankruptcy attorney that can help you determine your best option and the optimal bankruptcy petition filing date if bankruptcy is your best option.
Consult with a bankruptcy attorney in your area. Most offer a free consultation. Know you rights. A chapter 7 bankruptcy would provide you with a fresh start and Peace of Mind.

Bankruptcy sounds like a good option based on the facts presented. As mentioned, many debt relief agencies are scams, or won’t fully and completely resolve your financial issues. But, hire an attorney to represent you in bankruptcy.

File bankruptcy. Consult with some local bankruptcy attorneys to advise you when the next time might be for filing but, there is no real question here. Debt relief Ireland rarely work and they cost a lot more than coming bankruptcy will. Plus you'd probably end up getting sued by the creditor's that you thought the debt relief company was working with. File bankruptcy and you won't have to worry about that.
Editing the practice area for you, but many debt relief "programs" are basically scams. Consult with a bankruptcy attorney.
